comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.49.1b7

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:MC_Fitti

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
AdGuard Tracking Protection hides any of the Wiki widgets at the bottom of the page. This happens with any of the sites based off of the Wikimedia service (Basically most wikis out there). Caused by `##img[width="88"][height="31"]`.

comment.body:
As far as I understand, to reproduce this issue, it's necessary to go to - `https://www2.turkish123.org/home/` and then choose a video.
If so, it's probably caused by `Stealth mode`.
You have a lot of options enabled in `Stealth mode`, some of them are problematic and may cause problems on a lot of websites.
Please check if issue occurs if you disable `Stealth mode`.
If video will works correctly, please enable `Stealth mode` again and try to disable most problematic options:
```
Block third-party Authorization header
Hide your Referrer from third-parties
```
It might be also caused by:
```
Hide your User-Agent
Hide your IP address
```

comment.body:
Maybe possible use `set-cookie` scriptlets:

```adb
ubi.com#$#//scriptlet('set-cookie', 'UBI_PRIVACY_POLICY_VIEWED', 'true')
ubi.com#$#//scriptlet('set-cookie', 'UBI_PRIVACY_POLICY_ACCEPTED, 'true')
```

rest of cookies aren't needed to load YouTube iframe immediately.

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
It seems that sometimes there is a different subdomain (but it looks like that it always starts with `i`), so I have updated rule a bit:
```adblock
[$domain=/^i\[a-z\]*\.strmrdr\[a-z\]+\..*/]#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'adscfg.enabled', 'false')
```

>By the way, I want to reach the guide for this new feature, but is this link correct?

Yes, it's correct link.
According to documentation some characters should be escaped, but it looks like that it's not necessary.
>In the modifiers values of the following characters must be escaped: `[`, `]`, `,`, and `\` (unless it is used for the escaping). Use `\` to escape them. For example, an escaped bracket looks like this: `\]`.

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.12

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Enter a hot bilibili live broadcast room to reproduce

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
bilibili's live broadcast room will carry out p2p upload. use "live.bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('nowebrtc')" can stop it.
2. Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69903376/232044513-1a81bb50-9261-43c9-9ccf-fedf6be83192.png)

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
